title: President Kovind, FM Nirmala Sitharaman Rush To Help Policewoman Who Fell On Stage
text:
After a policewoman collapsed on the stage at an award function in Delhi, President Ram Nath Kovind, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Minister of State for Finance and Corporate Affairs Anurag Thakur attended to her and inquired about her.

According to PTI, the policewoman was standing at the front gate at Vigyan Bhawan during the first National CSR Awards function, when she slipped and twisted her ankle. According to a photographer who was present there, she fell and sat on the carpet while the National Anthem was being played.

The video of the incident went viral on social media.

Here is the video:

#WATCH A woman security personnel deputed at National Corporate Social Responsibility Awards event collapsed during playing of National Anthem, today.President Kovind, FM Nirmala Sitharaman & MoS Finance Anurag Thakur came down the stage to inquire about her health. #Delhi pic.twitter.com/HUSvzkizHu — ANI (@ANI) October 29, 2019

In the video we can see, three of them going down the stairs and talking to the policewoman to check on her. President Kovind had a brief conversation with the policewoman after Thakur offered her a bottle of water.

Once everything was fine, President Kovind was seen leaving the venue. The audience applauded him for his kind gesture.

The fact that VIP culture exists in our country is no secret. Time and again individuals and organisations have tried to discourage this culture but it is so deep-seated in our roots, that it is extremely difficult to completely get rid of. So, this gesture was both pleasantly surprising and heartwarming to witness.
